content.description: Romp out the right side of the cave to stand on the ledge by the first bolt. (The moves aren't too hard, but a stick clip is still prudent.) Head up and slightly left to the slightly overhanging face. Pull up the face on beautiful plates and pockets to a 4-star rest ledge about 3/4 of the way up. Take a nap on the ledge if you're feeling tuckered, then find the good pockets and finish up the last steep section to the anchors.
content.location: Where the Great Arch approach trail meets the cliff, look for a black streak running vertically up the face. The bolted line that goes up this streak is Beef Stick(5.12a). The next bolted line to the right is Night Moves. It starts out the right side of the cave.

content.description: An excellent and varied climb.  Pull your way through a few roofs with fun movement including a heel hook and toe cam. Experience nothing but jugs until you hit the crux about half way up. Continue with technical movement on basketball slopers until the chains.  True to the grade, this route won't disappoint.
content.location: Right side of the arch, tag is present under the route.

content.description: Climb a mungy corner into a traversing hand crack, then continue up a wide dihedral to the anchors.
content.protection: Normal to Bigger gear.  Anchors at the top.
content.location: Left of the bolted routes Dyn-o-mite and Black Powder

climbs.name: The Hunt For Red's October
climbs.fa: Steve Sandman, 2015.  Equipped by Erik Kloeker

content.description: Three distinctive boulder problems separated by good rests to a tall steep face on good holds.
content.location: Follow the cliffline a couple hundred yards right of the Great Arch until you reach an area called 'The Battlefield'

content.description: Direct start to Ear Drops that avoids the often wet section.
Easy jug haul on beautiful holds, excellent length for new 5.9 leaders.
content.location: left side of wall, this was one of the only tags I found on this cliff.

content.description: The first pitch has some long, hard moves.
content.location: On the left side of Great Arch

content.description: Getting established on the route is a bit tricky.
content.location: Heads up as black streak. Third route from the right

content.description:
Hop onto the ledge and stretch up to clip the bolt on the overhanging start. Haul yourself over the initial overhang on good horizontals and thin plates, and then start angling out right and up. Keep on truckin' through the continuous top half until you're at the anchors.

This line did feel a bit contrived to me. I had to constantly watch myself to make sure I wasn't climbing straight up into Dyn-o-mite. But if you stay on route, the rock and the moves are nice. A worthwhile endeavor if you're looking for something a step up from Dyn-o-mite.
content.location: Starts near the left end of the Great Arch, just to the right of the sport climb Dyn-o-mite.

content.description: This route starts just right of the approach trail.  Start the same as Night Moves in a cave.  A stick clip is recommended.  Move around right on some steep jugs to gain the first bolt.  Move above the first bolt to a nice ledge.  Step up and clip the first few bolts and get your rest.  Fire up the beautiful plates to a section of steep left facing side pulls (crux).  The last few bolts throw in some technical moves right when your arms are on fire!
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  Rap with a 60m rope into the trees below.
content.location: Just right of the approach trail.  Notice a beautiful orange streak running up a section of left facing side pulls.  Look for the tag also.
